trans-unit.source: How to manage media content with Azure Media Services using Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: How to manage media content with Azure Media Services using Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage your media content in Azure Media Services. This includes: uploading, indexing, encoding, encrypting, and publishing.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage your media content in Azure Media Services. This includes: uploading, indexing, encoding, encrypting, and publishing.

trans-unit.source: Manage Content with Azure Media Services using Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Manage Content with Azure Media Services using Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to use Azure Management Portal to manage media content in your Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to use Azure Management Portal to manage media content in your Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to perform the following content operations directly from the portal:
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to perform the following content operations directly from the portal:

trans-unit.source: View content information like published state, published URL, size, datetime of last update, and whether or not the asset is encrypted.
trans-unit.target: View content information like published state, published URL, size, datetime of last update, and whether or not the asset is encrypted.

trans-unit.source: Upload new content
trans-unit.target: Upload new content

trans-unit.source: Index content
trans-unit.target: Index content

trans-unit.source: Encode content
trans-unit.target: Encode content

trans-unit.source: Encrypt
trans-unit.target: Encrypt

trans-unit.source: Publish/Unpublish content
trans-unit.target: Publish/Unpublish content

trans-unit.source: Play content
trans-unit.target: Play content

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>How to: Upload content
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>How to: Upload content

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Media Services and then click on the Media Services account name.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Media Services and then click on the Media Services account name.

trans-unit.source: Select the CONTENT page.
trans-unit.target: Select the CONTENT page.

trans-unit.source: Click the Upload button on the page or at the bottom of the portal.
trans-unit.target: Click the Upload button on the page or at the bottom of the portal.

trans-unit.source: In the Upload content dialog, browse to the desired asset file.
trans-unit.target: In the Upload content dialog, browse to the desired asset file.

trans-unit.source: Click the file and then click Open or press Enter.
trans-unit.target: Click the file and then click Open or press Enter.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>UploadContentDialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>UploadContentDialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Upload Content dialog, click the check button to accept the File and Content Name.
trans-unit.target: In the Upload Content dialog, click the check button to accept the File and Content Name.

trans-unit.source: The upload will start and you can track progress from the bottom of the portal.
trans-unit.target: The upload will start and you can track progress from the bottom of the portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>JobStatus</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>JobStatus</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the upload has completed, you will see the new asset listed in the Content list.
trans-unit.target: Once the upload has completed, you will see the new asset listed in the Content list.

trans-unit.source: By convention the name will have "-Source" appended at the end to help track new content as source content for encoding tasks.
trans-unit.target: By convention the name will have "-Source" appended at the end to help track new content as source content for encoding tasks.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ContentPage</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ContentPage</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If the file size value does not get updated after the uploading process stops, press the Sync Metadata button.
trans-unit.target: If the file size value does not get updated after the uploading process stops, press the Sync Metadata button.

trans-unit.source: This synchronizes the asset file size with the actual file size in storage and refreshes the value on the Content page.
trans-unit.target: This synchronizes the asset file size with the actual file size in storage and refreshes the value on the Content page.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>How to: Index content
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>How to: Index content

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Indexer enables you to make content of your media files searchable and to generate a full-text transcript for closed captioning and keywords.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Indexer enables you to make content of your media files searchable and to generate a full-text transcript for closed captioning and keywords.

trans-unit.source: You can index your content using the Management Portal following the steps demonstrated below.
trans-unit.target: You can index your content using the Management Portal following the steps demonstrated below.

trans-unit.source: However, if you would like more control over what files and how the indexing job is done, you can use the Media Services SDK for .NET or REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: However, if you would like more control over what files and how the indexing job is done, you can use the Media Services SDK for .NET or REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Indexing Media Files with Azure Media Indexer</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Indexing Media Files with Azure Media Indexer</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To following steps demonstrate how to use the Management Portal to index your content.
trans-unit.target: To following steps demonstrate how to use the Management Portal to index your content.

trans-unit.source: Select the file that you would like to index.
trans-unit.target: Select the file that you would like to index.

trans-unit.source: If indexing is supported for this file type, the PROCESS button will be enabled on the bottom of the CONTENT page.
trans-unit.target: If indexing is supported for this file type, the PROCESS button will be enabled on the bottom of the CONTENT page.

trans-unit.source: Press the PROCESS button.
trans-unit.target: Press the PROCESS button.

trans-unit.source: In the Process dialog choose the Azure Media Indexer processor.
trans-unit.target: In the Process dialog choose the Azure Media Indexer processor.

trans-unit.source: Then, fill out the Process dialog the detailed title and description information of the input media file.
trans-unit.target: Then, fill out the Process dialog the detailed title and description information of the input media file.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Process</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Process</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>How to: Encode content
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>How to: Encode content

trans-unit.source: In order to deliver digital video over the internet you must compress the media.
trans-unit.target: In order to deliver digital video over the internet you must compress the media.

trans-unit.source: Media Services provides a media encoder that allows you to specify how you want for your content to be encoded (for example, the codecs to use, file format, resolution, and bitrate.)
trans-unit.target: Media Services provides a media encoder that allows you to specify how you want for your content to be encoded (for example, the codecs to use, file format, resolution, and bitrate.)

trans-unit.source: When working with Azure Media Services one of the most common scenarios is delivering adaptive bitrate streaming to your clients.
trans-unit.target: When working with Azure Media Services one of the most common scenarios is delivering adaptive bitrate streaming to your clients.

trans-unit.source: With adaptive bitrate streaming, the client can switch to a higher or lower bitrate stream as the video is displayed based on the current network bandwidth, CPU utilization, and other factors.
trans-unit.target: With adaptive bitrate streaming, the client can switch to a higher or lower bitrate stream as the video is displayed based on the current network bandwidth, CPU utilization, and other factors.

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports the following adaptive bitrate streaming technologies: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), Smooth Streaming, MPEG DASH, and HDS (for Adobe PrimeTime/Access licensees only).
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports the following adaptive bitrate streaming technologies: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), Smooth Streaming, MPEG DASH, and HDS (for Adobe PrimeTime/Access licensees only).

trans-unit.source: Media Services provides dynamic packaging which allows you to deliver your adaptive bitrate MP4 or Smooth Streaming encoded content in streaming formats supported by Media Services (MPEG DASH, HLS, Smooth Streaming, HDS) without you having to re-package into these streaming formats.
trans-unit.target: Media Services provides dynamic packaging which allows you to deliver your adaptive bitrate MP4 or Smooth Streaming encoded content in streaming formats supported by Media Services (MPEG DASH, HLS, Smooth Streaming, HDS) without you having to re-package into these streaming formats.

trans-unit.source: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you need to do the following:
trans-unit.target: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you need to do the following:

trans-unit.source: Encode your mezzanine (source) file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files (the encoding steps are demonstrated later in this tutorial).
trans-unit.target: Encode your mezzanine (source) file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files (the encoding steps are demonstrated later in this tutorial).

trans-unit.source: Get at least one On-Demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.
trans-unit.target: Get at least one On-Demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to Scale On-Demand Streaming Reserved Units</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to Scale On-Demand Streaming Reserved Units</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: With dynamic packaging you only need to store and pay for the files in single storage format and Media Services will build and serve the appropriate response based on requests from a client.
trans-unit.target: With dynamic packaging you only need to store and pay for the files in single storage format and Media Services will build and serve the appropriate response based on requests from a client.

trans-unit.source: Note that in addition to being able to use the dynamic packaging capabilities, On-Demand Streaming reserved units provide you with dedicated egress capacity that can be purchased in increments of 200 Mbps.
trans-unit.target: Note that in addition to being able to use the dynamic packaging capabilities, On-Demand Streaming reserved units provide you with dedicated egress capacity that can be purchased in increments of 200 Mbps.

trans-unit.source: By default, on-demand streaming is configured in a shared-instance model for which server resources (for example, compute, egress capacity, etc.)
trans-unit.target: By default, on-demand streaming is configured in a shared-instance model for which server resources (for example, compute, egress capacity, etc.)

trans-unit.source: are shared with all other users.
trans-unit.target: are shared with all other users.

trans-unit.source: To improve an on-demand streaming throughput, it is recommended to purchase On-Demand Streaming reserved units.
trans-unit.target: To improve an on-demand streaming throughput, it is recommended to purchase On-Demand Streaming reserved units.

trans-unit.source: This section describes the steps you can take to encode your content with Azure Media Encoder using the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This section describes the steps you can take to encode your content with Azure Media Encoder using the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Select the file that you would like to encode.
trans-unit.target: Select the file that you would like to encode.

trans-unit.source: If encoding is supported for this file type, the PROCESS button will be enabled on the bottom of the CONTENT page.
trans-unit.target: If encoding is supported for this file type, the PROCESS button will be enabled on the bottom of the CONTENT page.

trans-unit.source: In the Process dialog, select the Azure Media Encoder processor.
trans-unit.target: In the Process dialog, select the Azure Media Encoder processor.

trans-unit.source: Choose from one of the encoding configurations.
trans-unit.target: Choose from one of the encoding configurations.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Process2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Process2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Task Preset Strings for Azure Media Encoder topic explains what each preset in Presets for Adaptive Streaming (dynamic packaging), Presets for Progressive Download, Legacy Presets for Adaptive Streaming categories means.
trans-unit.target: The Task Preset Strings for Azure Media Encoder topic explains what each preset in Presets for Adaptive Streaming (dynamic packaging), Presets for Progressive Download, Legacy Presets for Adaptive Streaming categories means.

trans-unit.source: The Other configurations are described below:
trans-unit.target: The Other configurations are described below:

trans-unit.source: Encode with PlayReady content protection.
trans-unit.target: Encode with PlayReady content protection.

trans-unit.source: This preset produces an asset encoded with PlayReady content protection.
trans-unit.target: This preset produces an asset encoded with PlayReady content protection.

trans-unit.source: By default the Media Services PlayReady license service is used.
trans-unit.target: By default the Media Services PlayReady license service is used.

trans-unit.source: To specify some other service from which clients can obtain a license to play the PlayReady encrypted content, use REST or Media Services .NET SDK APIs.
trans-unit.target: To specify some other service from which clients can obtain a license to play the PlayReady encrypted content, use REST or Media Services .NET SDK APIs.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Using Static Encryption to Protect your Content and set the licenseAcquisitionUrl property in the Media Encryptor preset.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Using Static Encryption to Protect your Content and set the licenseAcquisitionUrl property in the Media Encryptor preset.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use dynamic encryption and set the PlayReadyLicenseAcquisitionUrl property as described in Using PlayReady Dynamic Encryption and License Delivery Service.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use dynamic encryption and set the PlayReadyLicenseAcquisitionUrl property as described in Using PlayReady Dynamic Encryption and License Delivery Service.

trans-unit.source: Playback on PC/Mac (via Flash/Silverlight).
trans-unit.target: Playback on PC/Mac (via Flash/Silverlight).

trans-unit.source: This preset produces a Smooth Streaming asset with the following characteristics: 44.1 kHz 16 bits/sample stereo audio CBR encoded at 96 kbps using AAC, and 720p video CBR encoded at 6 bitrates ranging from 3400 kbps to 400 kbps using H.264 Main Profile, and two second GOPs.
trans-unit.target: This preset produces a Smooth Streaming asset with the following characteristics: 44.1 kHz 16 bits/sample stereo audio CBR encoded at 96 kbps using AAC, and 720p video CBR encoded at 6 bitrates ranging from 3400 kbps to 400 kbps using H.264 Main Profile, and two second GOPs.

trans-unit.source: Playback via HTML5 (IE/Chrome/Safari).
trans-unit.target: Playback via HTML5 (IE/Chrome/Safari).

trans-unit.source: This preset produces a single MP4 file with the following characteristics: 44.1 kHz 16 bits/sample stereo audio CBR encoded at 128 kbps using AAC, and 720p video CBR encoded at 4500 kbps using H.264 Main Profile.
trans-unit.target: This preset produces a single MP4 file with the following characteristics: 44.1 kHz 16 bits/sample stereo audio CBR encoded at 128 kbps using AAC, and 720p video CBR encoded at 4500 kbps using H.264 Main Profile.

trans-unit.source: Playback on iOS devices and PC/Mac.
trans-unit.target: Playback on iOS devices and PC/Mac.

trans-unit.source: This preset produces an asset with the same characteristics as the Smooth Streaming asset (described above), but in a format that can be used to deliver Apple HLS streams to iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: This preset produces an asset with the same characteristics as the Smooth Streaming asset (described above), but in a format that can be used to deliver Apple HLS streams to iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: Then, enter the desired friendly output content name or accept the default.
trans-unit.target: Then, enter the desired friendly output content name or accept the default.

trans-unit.source: Then click the check button to start the encoding operation and you can track progress from the bottom of the portal.
trans-unit.target: Then click the check button to start the encoding operation and you can track progress from the bottom of the portal.

trans-unit.source: Press OK.
trans-unit.target: Press OK.

trans-unit.source: After the encoding is done, the CONTENT page will contain the encoded file.
trans-unit.target: After the encoding is done, the CONTENT page will contain the encoded file.

trans-unit.source: To view the progress of the encoding job, switch to the JOBS page.
trans-unit.target: To view the progress of the encoding job, switch to the JOBS page.

trans-unit.source: If the file size value does not get updated after the encoding is done, press the Sync Metadata button.
trans-unit.target: If the file size value does not get updated after the encoding is done, press the Sync Metadata button.

trans-unit.source: This synchronizes the output asset file size with the actual file size in storage and refreshes the value on the Content page.
trans-unit.target: This synchronizes the output asset file size with the actual file size in storage and refreshes the value on the Content page.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>How to: Encrypt content
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>How to: Encrypt content

trans-unit.source: If you want for Media Services to dynamically encrypt your asset with an AES key or PlayReady DRM make sure to do the following:
trans-unit.target: If you want for Media Services to dynamically encrypt your asset with an AES key or PlayReady DRM make sure to do the following:

trans-unit.source: Encode your mezzanine (source) file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files (the encoding steps are demonstrated in the <link><linkText>Encode</linkText><title></title></link> section).
trans-unit.target: Encode your mezzanine (source) file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files (the encoding steps are demonstrated in the <link><linkText>Encode</linkText><title></title></link> section).

trans-unit.source: Get at least one On-Demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.
trans-unit.target: Get at least one On-Demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to Scale On-Demand Streaming Reserved Units</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to Scale On-Demand Streaming Reserved Units</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure "default aes clear key service policy" or "default playready license service policy".
trans-unit.target: Configure "default aes clear key service policy" or "default playready license service policy".

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configure Content Key Authorization Policy</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configure Content Key Authorization Policy</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When you are ready to enable encryption, press the ENCRYPTION button on the bottom of the CONTENT page.
trans-unit.target: When you are ready to enable encryption, press the ENCRYPTION button on the bottom of the CONTENT page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Encrypt</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Encrypt</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once you enabled encryption, whenever a stream is requested by a player, Media Services uses the specified key to dynamically encrypt your content using AES or PlayReady encryption.
trans-unit.target: Once you enabled encryption, whenever a stream is requested by a player, Media Services uses the specified key to dynamically encrypt your content using AES or PlayReady encryption.

trans-unit.source: To decrypt the stream, the player will request the key from the key delivery service.
trans-unit.target: To decrypt the stream, the player will request the key from the key delivery service.

trans-unit.source: To decide whether or not the user is authorized to get the key, the service evaluates the authorization policies that you specified for the key.
trans-unit.target: To decide whether or not the user is authorized to get the key, the service evaluates the authorization policies that you specified for the key.

trans-unit.source: Also, see:
trans-unit.target: Also, see:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Protect with PlayReady DRM</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Protect with PlayReady DRM</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Protect with AES-128 key</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Protect with AES-128 key</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>How to: Publish content
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>How to: Publish content

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: To provide your user with a URL that can be used to stream or download your content, you first need to "publish" your asset by creating a locator.
trans-unit.target: To provide your user with a URL that can be used to stream or download your content, you first need to "publish" your asset by creating a locator.

trans-unit.source: Locators provide access to files contained in the asset.
trans-unit.target: Locators provide access to files contained in the asset.

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports two types of locators: OnDemandOrigin locators, used to stream media (for example, MPEG DASH, HLS, or Smooth Streaming) and Access Signature (SAS) locators, used to download media files.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports two types of locators: OnDemandOrigin locators, used to stream media (for example, MPEG DASH, HLS, or Smooth Streaming) and Access Signature (SAS) locators, used to download media files.

trans-unit.source: When you use the Azure Management Portal to publish your assets, the locators are created for you and you are provided with an OnDemantOrigin based URL (if your asset contains an .ism file) or a SAS URL.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Azure Management Portal to publish your assets, the locators are created for you and you are provided with an OnDemantOrigin based URL (if your asset contains an .ism file) or a SAS URL.

trans-unit.source: A SAS URL has the following format:
trans-unit.target: A SAS URL has the following format:

trans-unit.source: A streaming URL has the following format and you can use it to play Smooth Streaming assets:
trans-unit.target: A streaming URL has the following format and you can use it to play Smooth Streaming assets:

trans-unit.source: To build an HLS streaming URL, append (format=m3u8-aapl) to the URL.
trans-unit.target: To build an HLS streaming URL, append (format=m3u8-aapl) to the URL.

trans-unit.source: To build an MPEG DASH streaming URL, append (format=mpd-time-csf) to the URL.
trans-unit.target: To build an MPEG DASH streaming URL, append (format=mpd-time-csf) to the URL.

trans-unit.source: Locators have expiration date.
trans-unit.target: Locators have expiration date.

trans-unit.source: When using Portal to publish your assets, locators with a 100 years expiration date are created.
trans-unit.target: When using Portal to publish your assets, locators with a 100 years expiration date are created.

trans-unit.source: If you used Portal to create locators before March 2015, locators with a two year expiration date were created.
trans-unit.target: If you used Portal to create locators before March 2015, locators with a two year expiration date were created.

trans-unit.source: To update expiration date on a locator, use <link><linkText>REST</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>.NET</linkText><title></title></link> APIs.
trans-unit.target: To update expiration date on a locator, use <link><linkText>REST</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>.NET</linkText><title></title></link> APIs.

trans-unit.source: Note that when you update the expiration date of a SAS locator, the URL changes.
trans-unit.target: Note that when you update the expiration date of a SAS locator, the URL changes.

trans-unit.source: Publish
trans-unit.target: Publish

trans-unit.source: To use Portal to publish an asset, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To use Portal to publish an asset, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Select the asset.
trans-unit.target: Select the asset.

trans-unit.source: Then, click the publish button.
trans-unit.target: Then, click the publish button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>PublishedContent</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>PublishedContent</linkText>

trans-unit.source: How to: Play content from the portal
trans-unit.target: How to: Play content from the portal

trans-unit.source: The Azure Management Portal provides a content player that you can use to test your video.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Management Portal provides a content player that you can use to test your video.

trans-unit.source: Click on the desired video and click the Play button at the bottom of the portal.
trans-unit.target: Click on the desired video and click the Play button at the bottom of the portal.

trans-unit.source: Some considerations apply:
trans-unit.target: Some considerations apply:

trans-unit.source: Make sure the video has been published.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the video has been published.

trans-unit.source: The MEDIA SERVICES CONTENT PLAYER plays from the default streaming endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The MEDIA SERVICES CONTENT PLAYER plays from the default streaming endpoint.

trans-unit.source: If you want to play from a non-default streaming endpoint, use another player.
trans-unit.target: If you want to play from a non-default streaming endpoint, use another player.

trans-unit.source: For example, <link><linkText>Azure Media Services Player</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For example, <link><linkText>Azure Media Services Player</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>AMSPlayer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>AMSPlayer</linkText>
